image.altText: A large building with a lot of windows against a clear sky.

props.synopsis: Millions of irreplaceable biodiversity specimens are re-homed at a new CSIRO facility in Canberra as its chief executive speaks for the first time about plans for change at the organisation.

title.children: CSIRO opens $90 million 'cutting edge' research facility

image.altText: A close up of a high school student.

props.synopsis: More than 30 ACT schools will have better access to period products with the expansion of an ACT government pilot program.

title.children: Student's fight to end period poverty brings free pads into more schools

image.altText: ANU signage with Genevieve Bell and Julie Bishop

props.synopsis: The prestige of the Australian National University is fast fading. It must now respond to explosive allegations.

title.children: How one of the world's most prestigious universities fell from grace

image.altText: Julie Bishop stands in a conference room smiling

props.synopsis: ACT independent Senator David Pocock says he is concerned the issues facing the Australian National University are affecting its staff and students and calls for more transparency.

title.children: Bishop should stand aside from ANU role amid bullying claim, senator says

image.altText: Bottles of Pepsi are pictured at a grocery store in California.

props.synopsis: A bid by the Australian Tax Office to impose taxes on American soft drink giant PepsiCo has failed comprehensively, with the High Court throwing out the case.

title.children: High Court throws out ATO's case against soft drink giant PepsiCo

image.altText: Max and berts burnt

props.synopsis: Two heritage huts in the Namadgi National Park will not be rebuilt in an ACT government backflip, which experts say goes against heritage guidance and has left family and friends involved feeling betrayed.

title.children: 'Like a gravestone': The heritage huts that won't rise again

image.altText: Andrew Laming talks to the media at Parliament House

props.synopsis: Andrew Laming was the LNP member for Bowman in Queensland when the Australian Electoral Commission took issue with his Facebook posts.

title.children: Former MP Andrew Laming wins High Court appeal over Facebook post fines

image.altText: A woman wearing a denim jacket sitting at a desk with a microphone.

props.synopsis: Former member of the Australian National University council Liz Allen has used a Senate inquiry investigating university governance to allege Chancellor Julie Bishop harassed, bullied, and threatened her.

title.children: Julie Bishop accused of bullying by ANU staff member, senate inquiry hears

image.altText: A F-35 fighter jet flies during a ceremony.

props.synopsis: The federal government has upheld dozens of military export permits to Israel, raising fresh questions about Australia's weapons transfers throughout the war in Gaza.

title.children: Australia keeps military exports to Israel flowing during Gaza war

image.altText: Sussan Ley ABC

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley has questioned whether upcoming productivity talks are a "stitch-up" and a waste of time after documents leaked to the ABC outlined the round table's recommended outcomes. Follow live.

title.children: Ley says leaked Treasury documents show roundtable talks a 'stitch-up'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Treasury advice not government policy, just advice: Chalmers
Chalmers won't say whether govt will follow advice and pause National Construction Code

image.altText: Jim Chalmers in press conference

props.synopsis: The leaked advice reveals what the government expects to achieve at next week's productivity round table, recommending a freeze of the National Construction Code, and an AI plan to cut environmental red tape.

title.children: Leaked Treasury advice lists possible outcomes of Labor's yet to be held round table

image.altText: A crowd of men carry two covered bodies in stretchers past ruined buildings.

props.synopsis: Israel has provided documents it says justify its killing of a high-profile Palestinian journalist in Gaza. But the "trust us" mentality employed by Israeli authorities has long lost its power.

title.children: Israel's 'trust us' mentality loses power as it targets journalists

image.altText: Matt Wright leaving the Supreme Court of the Northern Territory, holding his wife's hand.

props.synopsis: The pilot who survived the fatal chopper crash at the centre of Matt Wright's trial has admitted to trafficking "very minimal" amounts of cocaine to friends prior to the accident, as he's cross-examined in court today. Follow live.

title.children: Pilot admits 'trafficking' cocaine before fatal chopper crash

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Pilot accepts he was not allowed to let Chris Wilson fly with him
Pilot says he has no memory of 'consuming cocaine' two days before crash

image.altText: Two men leaning towards each other to chat

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin has manipulated or scorned a string of US presidents. Now, the question remains whether Donald Trump is about to cement his place alongside them.

title.children: How Putin has used flattery and deception to 'fool' five US presidents

image.altText: Signage for the ANU.

props.synopsis: The prestige of the Australian National University is fast fading. It must now respond to explosive allegations.

title.children: How one of the world's most prestigious universities fell from grace

image.altText: People cross the road at an intersection in a busy CBD.

props.synopsis: Employment increased by nearly 25,000 people, driven by 60,000 full-time jobs, and the number of unemployed people also fell in the month.

title.children: Unemployment rate improves as full-time jobs surge

image.altText: Three pallets of aid floating against a blue sky with green parachutes.

props.synopsis: The parents of the 14-year-old boy speak of their grief after he was killed during an airdrop of humanitarian aid in Gaza earlier this week.

title.children: Deaths in Gaza from airdrops as countries try to deliver more aid

image.altText: Aerial view of salmon pens and boat in coastal waterway.

props.synopsis: Environmental groups had previously lodged a reconsideration request over a 2012 decision to allow for the expansion of salmon farming, over concerns for its impact on the endangered Maugean skate.

title.children: Federal government rules in favour of Macquarie Harbour salmon farms

image.altText: A golden mole in red desert sands eating a gecko.

props.synopsis: Many marsupials have become Aussie icons, such as kangaroos, koalas and wombats, yet we still need to pay more attention to this amazing group of animals, experts argue.

title.children: Why it's time to leave behind the colonial view our marsupials are 'inferior'

image.altText: Anthony Albanese Sussan Ley

props.synopsis: The partisan divide in Australia over how closely to align with the US has been steadily building since Donald Trump's return to the White House.

title.children: There's a growing divide between Labor and the Coalition over the United States

image.altText: legs of a young person in jeans in a dark stairwell.

props.synopsis: New data reveals a "sharp increase" in children in custody in NSW, with the number of Indigenous kids behind bars sparking a warning from the head of the state's crime research agency.

title.children: Aboriginal kids make up 60pc of youth detention population in NSW

image.altText: Business people walk outside the Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) in Sydney

props.synopsis: Australia's unemployment rate falls to 4.2 per cent as female participation hits a record high in July. The ABS's latest figures show about 25,000 jobs were added to the economy in the month. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: September rate cut odds ease as unemployment falls back to 4.2pc

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Unemployment falls back to 4.2 per cent
South32 shares down as Mozal smelter 'deadlocked'

image.altText: US first lady Melania Trump speaks into a microphone in front of a US flag

props.synopsis: Lawyers for the first lady of the United States said if ex-president's son fails to retract his statements, she will seek over $US1 billion in damages.

title.children: Melania Trump seeking over $US1 billion in damages from Hunter Biden

image.altText: Taylor Swift poses in a body of water in a glittering silver corset

props.synopsis: Taylor Swift's new album might be called The Life of a Showgirl, but her ability to whip her fans into a frenzy ahead of the announcement has one expert calling her a "marketing mastermind".

title.children: Taylor Swift, the showgirl? Her album launch has her labelled a 'marketing mastermind'

image.altText: Rawson Kirkhope, who has dark brown hair and blue eyes, poses for a photo in a black t-shirt, his arms folded

props.synopsis: For years Rawson Kirkhope tried to outrun his trauma, self-medicating with booze, soaking in the toxic cultures of football and the navy. Now he's turning a struggle he was ashamed of into a recovery story he's proud to share.

title.children: Domestic violence and a vicious shooting left Rawson with PTSD and a choice

image.altText: Man in suit talking at a press conference

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian Labor leader says his conversations with the crossbench MPs have been "mostly really positive", including at a meeting on Tuesday, that he claimed the Greens chose not to attend.

title.children: Winter still hopeful he'll become premier, despite stalled Greens negotiations

image.altText: A large concrete office building with glass windows on a cloudy day, with Alcoa written in large letters.

props.synopsis: US aluminium giant Alcoa's proposed expansions to its mining operations near Perth would release three years' worth of Australia's greenhouse gas emissions over their lifetime, documents show.

title.children: Perth council rejects Alcoa bauxite drilling over water, forest concerns

image.altText: GettyImages-633654696

props.synopsis: Through selection, the "Darcy Vescio Show" and the after party till 5am — this is the inside story of the first AFLW game.

title.children: Making history and partying to sunrise: The story of the first AFLW game

image.altText: Mercer

props.synopsis: Australia's corporate watchdog has launched legal action against superannuation giant Mercer, alleging the fund failed to report serious issues whereby they charged members insurance premiums after they had died, created member accounts without default insurance cover, and failed to process updates to member information.

title.children: 'Systemic failure by Mercer Super,' ASIC alleges, as it takes $70b fund to court

image.altText: A generic photo of a children's toy truck laying sideways, with a colourful abacus in the background.

props.synopsis: Children's commissioner Anne Hollonds says regulations are far too weak in a sector supposed to care for Australia's youngest and most vulnerable citizens.

title.children: Government scrambles to revoke check after latest childcare allegations surface

image.altText: An adults holds a baby's feet in the palm of their hands.

props.synopsis: Mapping the vast number of environmental and lifestyle factors that influence our health is an enormous task — but one researchers say could hold the key to better understanding disease development.

title.children: Two decades after mapping the human genome, scientists look to the 'exposome'

image.altText: A close up image of the face of Mohamed Al Fayed wearing a grey blazer jacket

props.synopsis: British police say at least 146 people are being treated as victims of late Harrods boss and accused sex offender Mohamed Al Fayed.

title.children: Late Harrods boss Mohamed Al Fayed has over 140 victims, police say

image.altText: Palestine March Sydney Harbour Bridge

props.synopsis: When Australia formally recognises the state of Palestine at the UN Assembly next month, it will join others who have done so since the Palestinian Declaration of Independence in 1988. Here's a look how countries from across the Asia Pacific region view Palestinian independence.

title.children: Will Australia's shift on Palestinian state impact our alliances in the region?

image.altText: A large grey navy ship sails through open water against a grey-blue sky

props.synopsis: The US Navy's operation was the first in the South China Sea's Scarborough Shoal region in at least six years.

title.children: China and US clash over South China Sea operation near disputed shoal

image.altText: A close-up of a mosquito, brown with white spots, on human skin.

props.synopsis: Dengue fever has killed 18 people and health authorities have recorded tens of thousands of cases in the Pacific.

title.children: 'Don't get bitten': Authorities mobilise against Pacific dengue outbreak
